## Survey design and function
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(cchsflow)
library(plotly)
library(srvyr)
library(survey)
library(tidyr)

# Design for 2001-2014 without bootstrap
harmonized_2001_2014 <- harmonized_combined[!(harmonized_combined$year==2015|harmonized_combined$year==2017),]
svy_design <- srvyr::as_survey_design(.data=harmonized_2001_2014, weights="WTS_M")

# Design for 2015-2018 bootstrap
svy_design_2015_2018 <- srvyr::as_survey_rep(harmonized_bsw,
                               repweights = starts_with("BSW"),
                               weights = WTS_M,
                               type = "bootstrap",
                               bsw.weights = TRUE)

#2011 census population standardization (age and sex)
pop2011 <- c(4962765,3524640,3459035,1281440,917340,4910365,3649325,3593270,1393345,1352950)

```

```{r}
prev_plot <- function(design, design_bsw, sum_var, filter_value, stdpop, startyear, title){
  
  # Prevalence for 2000-2014 
  table_non_bsw <- svystandardize(design,by = ~Age_Group+DHH_SEX, population = stdpop)%>%
    group_by(year,Immigration, {{sum_var}}) %>%
    summarise(Prevalence = round(survey_mean()*100, 2)) %>%
    filter({{sum_var}} == filter_value) %>%
    select(-Prevalence_se, -{{sum_var}})
  
   # Prevalence for bsw in 2015-2018
  table_bsw <- svystandardize(design_bsw, by = ~Age_Group+DHH_SEX, population = stdpop)%>%
    group_by(year, Immigration, {{sum_var}}) %>%
    summarise(Prevalence = round(survey_mean(vartype = "ci")*100, 2)) %>%
    filter({{sum_var}} == filter_value) %>%
    select(-{{sum_var}})
  
  # Combine table
  table_ci <- bind_rows(table_non_bsw, table_bsw)
  
  # Plot
  plot <- ggplot(table_ci, aes(x=year, y=Prevalence))+
  geom_line(aes(colour=Immigration))+
  geom_point(aes(colour=Immigration)) +
  ylab("Prevalence (%)")+
  xlab("Year")+
  ggtitle(title)+
  labs(colours="Migration Groups")+
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        # legend.position = "none",
        # panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        # panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
        # panel.background = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_line(colour = "black"),
        panel.border = element_rect(colour = "black", fill=NA))+
  scale_y_continuous(limit=c(0,62))+
  scale_x_discrete(limits=c(2001,2005,2009,2013,2017))+
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Paired") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 2015, linetype="dashed") +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = Prevalence_low, ymax = Prevalence_upp, fill = Immigration),
              alpha=0.1, linetype="dashed", color="grey")
  
  return(plot)
}
```

## Plots 
```{r Hypertension}
ht_plot <-prev_plot(svy_design, svy_design_2015_2018, CCC_071, 1, pop2011, 2001, "Hypertension")
ggplotly(ht_plot)
```

```{r Diabetes}
db_plot <-prev_plot(svy_design, svy_design_2015_2018, CCC_101, 1, pop2011, 2001, "Diabetes")
ggplotly(db_plot)
```

```{r Blood cholesterol}
bc_plot <-prev_plot(svy_design, svy_design_2015_2018, CCC_075, 1, pop2011, 2015, "High blood cholesterol")

```

